summary:
Generation X, or Gen X, is a group of people born between 1965 and 1980. They followed the Baby Boomers and came before the Millennials. In the U.S., there are about 65 million Gen Xers. As kids, they were known as the "Latchkey Generation" since they often came home to an empty house and had to let themselves in. This was due to changing family structures and more women working.

In their youth, Gen Xers were often called the "MTV Generation" and were seen as a bit lazy and unhappy. But as adults, research shows they are active, happy, and balance work and life well. They are also known for being entrepreneurial.
title: Generation X
